intro: Hymenasplenium pseudobscurum, commonly known as the dark green spleenwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a cryptogamic plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocky surfaces or decaying wood. The plant has a thalloid structure with a dorsiventral leaf-like structure, and it lacks true roots, stems, and leaves. It reproduces through spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporangia. Hymenasplenium pseudobscurum plays a role in nutrient cycling in its ecosystem and is often used as an indicator of environmental conditions.
